Mikado.configuration package¶

Submodules¶

Mikado.configuration.configurator module¶

This module defines the functionalities needed to verify the integrity and completeness of Mikado.py configuration files. Missing values are replaced with default ones, while existing values are checked for type and consistency.

Mikado.configuration.configurator.check_all_requirements(json_conf)[source]¶

Function to check all the “requirements” sections of the configuration.

Parameters:json_conf (dict) – the dictionary to be checked.
Returns:json_conf

:rtype dict

Mikado.configuration.configurator.check_blast(json_conf, json_file)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • json_conf (dict) – configuration dictionary to check.
  • json_file (str) – the original JSON file name (necessary to derive its parent folder)

Function to check the optional “blast” section of the configuration. It will be created (with “execute” set to False) if it is missing.

Returns:json_conf

:rtype dict

Mikado.configuration.configurator.check_db(json_conf)[source]¶

Function to check the validity of the database options. :param json_conf: :return:

Mikado.configuration.configurator.check_json(json_conf, simple=False)[source]¶

Wrapper for the various checks performed on the configuration file.

Parameters:
  • json_conf (dict) – The dicitonary loaded from the configuration file.
  • simple (bool) – boolean flag indicating whether we desire the simplified version of the configuration, or not.

:return json_conf :rtype: dict

Mikado.configuration.configurator.check_requirements(json_conf, require_schema)[source]¶

Function to check the “requirements” section of the configuration. Each filtering function will be checked for: - validity of the expression (it can be interpreted by Mikado.py) - validity of the parameter (it is a valid Metric)

Parameters:
  • json_conf (dict) – configuration dictionary to check.
  • require_schema (dict) – the requirements section of the JSON schema.
Returns:

json_conf

:rtype dict

Mikado.configuration.configurator.check_scoring(json_conf)[source]¶
Parameters:json_conf (dict) – configuration dictionary to check.

Function to check the “scoring” section of the configuration. Each scoring function will be checked for: - validity of the expression (it can be interpreted by Mikado.py) - validity of the parameter (it is a valid Metric)

Returns:json_conf

:rtype dict

Mikado.configuration.configurator.create_validator(simple=False)[source]¶

Method to create a validator class (see extend_with_default). The simple keyword (boolean) is used to determine whether to keep only SimpleComment or full Comments from the schema.

:return validator :rtype: jsonschema.Draft4Validator

Mikado.configuration.configurator.extend_with_default(validator_class, simple=False)[source]¶

Function to extend the normal validation classes for jsonschema so that they also set the default values provided inside the schema itself. Source: https://python-jsonschema.readthedocs.org/en/latest/faq/?highlight=default :param validator_class: the validator class to extend (e.g. Draft4Validator)

Parameters:simple (bool) – boolean flag. If set to True, only required properties will be extended.
Returns:
Mikado.configuration.configurator.merge_dictionaries(dict_a, dict_b, path=None)[source]¶

Recursive function to merge two dictionaries.

Parameters:
  • dict_a (dict) – first dictionary
  • dict_b (dict) – second dictionary
  • path (list(str)) – list to be updated during recursion to indicate that we are in a secondary node

Source: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7204805/dictionaries-of-dictionaries-merge

Mikado.configuration.configurator.to_json(string, simple=False)[source]¶

Function to serialise the JSON for configuration and check its consistency.

Parameters:
  • string ((str | None)) – the configuration file name.
  • simple (bool) – boolean flag indicating whether we desire the simplified version of the configuration, or not.

Module contents¶

This module defines the functions needed to check the sanity of the configuration file, plus the JSON schemas for the configuration and scoring files.
